The Charlotte Hornets and Orlando Magic plan to interview Jerry Stackhouse — head coach of the Toronto Raptors’ G League team — for their head-coaching positions, league sources told Yahoo Sports. Stackhouse will also interview for the New York Knicks’ coaching job this week, league sources said.

context_meta.title: Charles Barkley Calls Timberwolves "One Of The Dumbest Teams"
context_meta.summary: On Sunday, the Minnesota Timberwolves squared off against the Houston Rockets in game 1 of the NBA playoffs; the latter team were able to best their opponents 104-101 in a relatively tight match. However, not everyone was satisfied with how the Timberwolves played, most notably Charles Barkley, who offered a particularly caustic critique of team during one of his ritual half-time rants.  Barkley was frustrated with how the Timberwolves missed out on some opportunities to gain an advantage over the Rockets throughout the first half. The retired basketball player did not appreciate how the team did not attack mismatches in an effective manner when Houston switched pick-and-rolls and put a guard

context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: Lakers News: Luke Walton Praises Luol Deng For Aiding Team Despite Not Playing
context_meta.summary: In the summer of 2016 the Los Angeles Lakers signed Luol Deng a four-year, $72 million contract. The move raised eyebrows around the league and now Deng's contract is considered one of the most difficult to trade. With the team committed to building around their young core and hoping to find a new home for Deng, he played a total of 13 minutes during the 2017-18 campaign. All of them came in the season opener against the Clippers. It wasn't an easy situation for the veteran Deng, who has been used to being a key contributor over the course of his 14-year NBA career. Unfortunately, Deng's massive contract, and the complications it brings to the team's salary cap, has made him a target for criticism.

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: Sunday's NBA playoffs: Pacers stun Cavs, LeBron
context_meta.summary: Cleveland — LeBron James figured he had experienced everything in 12 postseasons. Turns out, there was something new. Victor Oladipo scored 32 points and Indiana outplayed Cleveland from the start while pulling off a stunning 98-80 victory Sunday in the series opener, handing James and the Cavaliers' their first loss in the opening round in eight years. It also was the first playoff-opening loss for James, who came in 12-0 in Game 1s and didn't realize he had been perfect starting the postseason. “Is it?” James said. “I've never lost a game in the first round before in my career? But while he knows the narrative before Wednesday's Game 2 will be on the struggles of Cleveland's playoff newcomers,

context_meta.summary: On Saturday, Thunder forward Paul George told reporters about an alter-ego he calls ''Playoff P.'' On Sunday, he gave the media, his teammates and the Utah Jazz a formal introduction. ''That's his new name?'' seemingly perplexed teammate Carmelo Anthony asked with a smile. George lived up to it.

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Harden's step-back move had fans shouting travel
context_meta.summary: James Harden is one of the NBA's most dynamic scorers and the favorite to win MVP this season. He's a challenge for any player to defend, and when he's getting away with the move below, he's impossible. During Game 1 of the Rockets' first-round matchup with the Timberwolves, Harden broke down Andrew Wiggins off the dribble and knocked down a step-back 3. The footwork was incredible. It was also a blatant travel. Harden took four steps back after he picked up his dribble. It was done quickly, and it wasn't called. NBA fans certainly took notice, though. They all had the same reaction. But let's be realistic - no NBA ref is going to call that a travel. They even let this one go.

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: James Harden Erupts for 44 Points as Rockets Beat Jimmy Butler, Timberwolves
context_meta.summary: James Harden apparently isn't slowing down in the playoffs after an incredible regular season.  The Houston Rockets star scored 44, including 13 in the fourth quarter, to help the No. 1 seed in the West survive with a 104-101 Game 1 win over the Minnesota Timberwolves.  Andrew Wiggins scored 18 for the Timberwolves in their first playoff game in 14 years, but it wasn't enough to keep up with Harden and the Rockets offense. This article will be updated to provide more information on this story as it becomes available.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: How Lance Stephenson made an impact, literally, against LeBron James in Game 1
context_meta.summary: Lance Stephenson didn't waste any time making an impact in the Indiana Pacers' series against the Cleveland Cavaliers. He gave LeBron James a really hard (but common) foul, drove for a monster dunk (and head-butted the basket support), hit a corner 3-pointer and more -- and that was all in the first quarter. Lance had 9 points and 4 rebounds as the Pacers led 55-38 at halftime. Stephenson clubbed James on the head late in the third quarter. Lance gets a personal foul and a technical foul, but it's not a flagrant foul. Stephenson finished with 12 points and 5 rebounds in Indiana's 98-80 win. context_meta.title: The Knicks-Mike Woodson interest is officially mutual
context_meta.summary: Former Knicks coach Mike Woodson got his wish. One day after telling The Post he would “love” to interview with the Knicks to “finish what I started,” team brass received permission from the Clippers on Sunday to talk to Doc Rivers' top assistant, according to a league source who confirmed an ESPN report. Woodson was arguably their best coach since Jeff Van Gundy, who resigned in 2001. He has been with Los Angeles since Phil Jackson fired him following the 2013-14 season and finished with a Knicks career record of 109-79. He has worked with both Knicks president Steve Mills and GM Scott Perry in the past. Woodson's final season in New York was under Mills' watch, and he was with Perry in Detroit

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: Lakers Hold 25th Overall Pick In First Round Of 2018 NBA Draft
context_meta.summary: At this year's trade deadline the Los Angeles Lakers pulled off a deal that sent Larry Nance Jr. and Jordan Clarkson to the Cleveland Cavaliers. In exchange the Lakers received Isaiah Thomas, Channing Frye, and Cleveland's 2018 first-round pick. Much of the focus initially was on the acquisition of Thomas, a lifelong Lakers fan who had interest in joining the team as a free agent in 2014. Additionally, there was a lot of attention paid to the amount of salary cap space the Lakers created with the deal, but considering the team's recent draft history, that first-round pick is huge.
